My ROIs
Dashboard

Select a section below to review your ROI

To calculate your return on investment, begin with the first section below. The information entered therein will automatically populate corresponding fields in the other sections. You will be able to move from section to section to add and/or adjust values to best reflect your organization and process. To return to this screen, click the ROI Dashboard button to the left.

This ROI calculator is offered as a way of understanding potential benefits of Fusion Framework System and related software from Fusion Risk Management. No claim is made of specific accuracy or commitments to deliver any system at the cost or benefit levels portrayed. The calculated numbers are estimates of savings only and are not considered to be commitments from either Fusion Risk Management or the prospective user of Fusion's solutions.

Your Company Profile - Current Costs
Core Team
Number of people involved in the Core Team of the program

attributes.title: The number of people who spend a significant part of their day working on the program.

children.html: Average percent of time the Core Team is allocated to work on the program

attributes.title: If the core team is dedicated to the program, enter 100%. If a portion of time is spent on other programs, deduct that percent. If the core team spends 25% of their time on other duties, enter 75% here.

children.html: Number of Core Team FTEs

attributes.title: Click here to view the calculation breakdown
This is a calculated field. It represents the number of full-time people that would be required to perform the program duties of all core team members combined.

children.html: Work Hours per Year

attributes.title: Enter the number of hours in your organization's work year. Five days a week for 52 weeks a year is 2080. Removing two weeks of vacation would make this value 2000. This number is used to calculate the number of FTEs working on your program.

children.html: Average direct annual compensation PER employee (FTE)

attributes.title: Enter the average salary for members of the core team (not including benefits).

children.html: Benefits Load

attributes.title: Enter your organization's benefits load percentage that should be added to the salary to come up with a loaded cost per employee. Typically, benefits add 20-35% to the cost of an employee.

children.html: Expected annual salary growth rate

attributes.title: Enter the expected or typical annual salary increase percentage that should be added to calculations for years 2 and 3.

children.html: Core Team employee expenditure

attributes.title: Click here to view the calculation breakdown
Calculated field that represents the loaded salary cost of the core team's time spent working on the program.

children.html: Plan and Process Owners
Approximate direct annual compensation of Plan and Process Owners

attributes.title: Enter a number that represents the average annual salary for those departmental users who are responsible for business processes and resiliency plans. This defaults to the average salary entered for the Core Team, but it can be overridden.

children.html: Identify the activities your Plan and Process Owners participate in:
Other Plan and Process activities
Number of Plan and Process Owners involved in the program

attributes.title: Enter the number of people that would be required to log into the system outside of the core team to enter process and planning information for their department. These are the users who are responsible for the accuracy of their information.

children.html: Amount of time each Plan and Process Owner spends working on the program (in hours) annually

attributes.title: Based on the activities you identified above, enter the amount of time each year that each Plan/Process owner spends (on average) performing their assigned activities.

children.html: hours
Number of Plan and Process Owner FTEs

attributes.title: Click here to view the calculation breakdown
This is a calculated field. It represents the number of full-time people that would be required to perform the program duties of all plan and process owners combined.

children.html: Plan and Process Owners employee expenditure

attributes.title: Click here to view the calculation breakdown
This is a calculated field that indicates the annual loaded salary cost for the time spent on the program by Plan and Process owners.

children.html: Other Stakeholders
Identify the activities your Other Stakeholders participate in:
Other stakeholder activities
Number of Other Stakeholders involved in these activities across your organization

attributes.title: Enter the number of people

children.html: Amount of time each Other Stakeholder spends working on the program (in hours) annually

attributes.title: Based on the activities you identified above, enter the amount of time each year that each other stakeholder spends (on average) performing their assigned activities.

children.html: Number of Other Stakeholder FTEs

attributes.title: Click here to view the calculation breakdown
This is a calculated field. It represents the number of full-time people that would be required to perform the program duties of all other stakeholders combined.

children.html: Other Stakeholders employee expenditure

attributes.title: Click here to view the calculation breakdown
This is a calculated field that indicates the annual loaded salary cost for the time spent on the program by Other Stakeholders.

children.html: Program Efficiency and Effectiveness
Program Activity Analysis
Allocate the time your organization spends on key categories of your program. What amount of time is spent focusing on the following areas (total must equal 100%):
Impact Analysis

attributes.title: Impact Analysis includes defining business processes, performing tasks related to data collection for and documentation of business impact analyses, and prioritizing the most important business processes to focus on.

children.html: Planning

attributes.title: Planning includes creating a documented approach to plan for events that could disrupt operations or have other negative impacts on the organization or its systems.

children.html: Management, Governance, & Compliance

attributes.title: Management, Governance & Compliance includes overall program management using metrics, managing plan approvals, communicating with plan and process owners, monitoring for compliance to standards, and responding to external requests including audits

children.html: Exercises and Incident Preparedness

attributes.title: Exercises and Incident Preparedness includes planning and execution of exercises that will enhance the ability of the organization to actually respond when a real event occurs.

children.html: Other

attributes.title: Click here to view the calculation breakdown
If you have other areas that apply to your program but are not incorporated in the other categories, you can list them in the Other section below.

children.html: What's Possible
Prioritize what Fusion makes possible for you. On a scale of 1-5 what capabilities are most valuable to your program.
Establishing an Information Foundation Click to learn more
Manage and leverage data to drive program success.
Map and explore dependencies between all business entities.
Integrate data from external applications (ENS, ITSM, CMDB).
Clearly identify owner responsibilities for all data.
Unprecedented flexibility to configure the system to address complex and evolving needs.
Improving and Simplifying your Planning and Preparation Click to learn more
Establish an effective and efficient plan management capability.
Ensure plans are current, accurate, and actionable.
Ensure standards are met while allowing for departmental flexibility
Define sequence of activities to ensure plans are executed properly
Automate the plan maintenance reminder process.
Render plans in multiple formats to suit different purposes and audiences.
Exercising Plans Efficiently and Enhancing Your Incident Management Capabilities Click to learn more
Reduce time spent planning and preparing exercises.
Run more efficient exercises.
Map organizational data and external situational intelligence to drive targeted responses.
Build a focused response to an incident by selecting only the impacted plans and functions.
Manage your activated plans from an interactive incident dashboard.
Automate after action reporting and track plan remediation based on exercises.
Engaging the Enterprise Click to learn more
Provide mobile access to plans and information to improve outcomes.
Enable employees to report situations from anywhere.
Enable distributed users to approve plans and participate in exercises.
Tailor the user experience to engage users with diverse requirements.
Management, Governance and Compliance of Your Program Click to learn more
Deliver reports and dashboards that provide invaluable insights.
Efficiently package data analytics to support better decision making.
Automatically manage your teams and contact information.
Leverage automated Workflows and Alerts to drive currency and efficiency.
Quickly respond to ad hoc queries from your executive team.
Leveraging the Right Platform for Success Click to learn more
Enterprise-grade security that meets the strictest compliance and regulatory obligations today and in the future.
Control user access to data down to the field level to precisely tailor the user experience.
Ability to scale your program to any size and number of users.
Support multiple languages.
Robust resiliency to increase the availability of your critical data when you need it most.
Complete set of integration options to external data sources.
Rich encryption capabilities to secure your most valuable and confidential information.
